events.message: Customer reported a car accident that occurred on the highway involving their vehicle and another driver.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of the initial report and accident details.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the claim and contact the customer for further information.
Customer was notified that the claim has been received and is officially being processed by the company.
The customer was asked to submit accident photos, police report, and vehicle damage estimate documentation.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including clear images of the damaged car and official police report.
Investigation commenced to assess accident circumstances and liability based on submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded confirming that the customer was not at fault for the vehicle collision.
A settlement offer was made to the customer covering repair costs and rental car coverage during repairs.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the claim handling speed.
The claim was officially approved, authorizing repair shop payments and rental car reimbursement.
Payment was sent to the approved auto repair facility and rental company as part of the settlement.
The claim was closed after confirming completion of all repairs and customer satisfaction with the service.
All claim records were archived safely for future reference and audit purposes following company policy.
